title: coinremitter
author: coinremitter
content: Have an online business and want to accept payments in crypto but have a fear of high transaction fees?Have access to a lot of crypto-related servicesHello, everyone I am from Coinrmeitter. We always looking for those merchants who want to accept crypto payments on their websites. Get paid in bitcoin and other cryptos, for products and services you are providing online.Here are the steps:-First Sign Up at https://coinremitter.com/signup and make your account. Then create a wallet. For example, if you want to accept bitcoin payments then create a bitcoin wallet.After that put your external address where you want to transfer your payment from the coinrmeitter’s wallet.You can also create an Invoice as well. For that, you can click on the invoice and fill up every detail and send it to your customer.If you love our payment gateway, you can like and follow us on social media and forums.If you are getting curious or have questions about Coinrmeitter then you simply contact us through the mail - https://coinremitter.com/support

comments.author: Broadanbig
comments.body: Quote from: coinremitter on February 13, 2023, 06:22:00 AMHave an online business and want to accept payments in crypto but have a fear of high transaction fees?Have access to a lot of crypto-related servicesHello, everyone I am from Coinrmeitter. We always looking for those merchants who want to accept crypto payments on their websites. Then create a wallet. For example, if you want to accept bitcoin payments then create a bitcoin wallet.After that put your external address where you want to transfer your payment from the coinrmeitter’s wallet.You can also create an Invoice as well. For that, you can click on the invoice and fill up every detail and send it to your customer.If you love our payment gateway, you can like and follow us on social media and forums.If you are getting curious or have questions about Coinrmeitter then you simply contact us through the mail - https://coinremitter.com/support Welcome onboard. It is good having you here. Your platform seems more like a web wallet option and you are in possession of wallet private keys of account holders on your platform  which I do not think is feasible with me. I checked your website and found out no details about your license. From the settings of your project, it looks more of you likely conducting kyc in the nearest future why not state it clear about your kyc policy so that potential customers would see what they are signing up for so as to avoid having issues in the later. I am saying this as I have gotten lots of experience on this issue of kyc and lots where by a project from onset would state being kyc free but upon deposit of funds, they claim the transaction to be suspicious and fraudulent and start demanding for kyc documents and lots more which is not part of the whole terms and conditions when registering on the platform.I stumbled upon this "To provide the Services, we may share information about you and your Coinremitter account with third parties. All the information that can be shared is what you give us while creating a coinremitter merchant account. There is always certain risk attached to it so kindly read our Disclaimer & Risk Warning" and who are these third parties you are talking about why not state it clear so that we may know rather than keeping it a secret. Let us know who the third parties are.And lastly who are the team members behind this project?
